Posts.Content:
try not to worry. This has happened to me twice now thanks to my hard to read dense breast tissue. Both times needed biopsy....both times all was well. Deep breaths!
Marianne- age 48
DX Pancolitis in 2005. Family history of UC. Symptoms started shortly after I quit smoking
Tried every drug-even Remicade & Cyclosporine-Tried diets-nothing worked.
Step 1: J-pouch surgery (Laparoscopic restorative proctocolectomy w/ temporary diverting loop ileostomy) 6-25-10
Step 2: Take down surgery (Ileostomy reversal) 10/8/10
No more UC and no more drugs! Very happy j-poucher
Posts.Title: Second Call back On Mammogram and scared

Posts.Content:
Hi! I read posts on here from time to time because my mother is being treated for breast cancer right now. I just wanted to say that I had a similar scare this past January...right at the same time my mom was diagnosed! Plus I just had gotten finished with surgery for my UC. I went for a biopsy with a breast specialist and it turned out to be a calcification with normal cells. I know what you mean about
 the waiting...it's awful...but most likely you will have nothing to worry about
. 
Best wishes!
Marianne
DX UC - in 2005 when I was 37
Tried every drug-even Remicade-nothing worked
Step 1: J-pouch surgery (Laparoscopic restorative proctocolectomy w/ temporary diverting loop ileostomy)6-25-10
Step 2: Take down surgery (Ileostomy reversal)10/8/10
Very pleased with my results
Posts.Title: Terrified, found a lump in my breast and am now waiting for appointment with surgeon.
